intro: Cereaster triangularis, commonly known as the triangular starwort, is a small flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its triangular leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. It typically grows in moist, rocky habitats such as streambanks and meadows. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
